intro: Stenochloa, commonly known as the narrowleaf grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, elongated leaves. The genus includes several species, many of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. Stenochloa plants typically produce small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. These plants are often found in dry, open habitats and are adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
